pullRequest.title: Issue #533 - i18n.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Also replaced slf4j with JUL in the API module(as this needs to boil up to the spec, so we should not introduce new dependency)
For all other modules replaced slf4J with JBoss Logger and adding i18n.
I had to remove annotationprocessor in the compile plugin in the pom, but the build still works.
For some tests (like mosqito) I had to keep slf4j, but for most replace with JBoss Logger.
Signed-off-by:Phillip Kruger phillip.kruger@gmail.com

commit.message:
Issue #533 - i18n.

Also replaced slf4j with JUL in the API module(as this needs to boil up to the spec, so we should not introduce new dependency)

For all other modules replaced slf4J with JBoss Logger and adding i18n.

I had to remove annotationprocessor in the compile plugin in the pom, but the build still works.

For some tests (like mosqito) I had to keep slf4j, but for most replace with JBoss Logger.
Signed-off-by:Phillip Kruger <phillip.kruger@gmail.com>

commit.message:

nodes.bodyText: You should add a note but using JUL/JBoss Logging instead.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -75,19 +75,4 @@ Running the previous example should give the following output:
 >> SMALLRYE
 >> REACTIVE
 >> MESSAGE
-----
-
-[NOTE]
-====
-SmallRye Reactive Messaging uses SLF4J as logger.
-Check the https://www.slf4j.org/manual.html[SLF4J documentation] to configure the logs.
-For testing purpose, you can simply add the following dependency to your `pom.xml` file:
-[source,xml]
-----
-<dependency>
-  <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
-  <artifactId>slf4j-simple</artifactId>
-  <version>1.7.30</version>
-</dependency>
-----
-====
+----

nodes.bodyText:
JBoss logging no?
Can you link to the project documentation page as it's not as known as SLF4J.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -79,15 +79,18 @@ Running the previous example should give the following output:
 
 [NOTE]
 ====
-SmallRye Reactive Messaging uses SLF4J as logger.
-Check the https://www.slf4j.org/manual.html[SLF4J documentation] to configure the logs.
+SmallRye Reactive Messaging uses JBoss-logger as logger.

nodes.bodyText:
This version should be set. The best is to use attributes for this. With Antora it's a bit messy:

in documentation/src/main/antora/antora.yaml add a line for the JBoss logging version:

jboss-logging-version: '${jboss-logging.version}'



in the documentation/pom.xml or in the root pom.xml declare the jboss-logging.version property


in the getting-started document, use {jboss-logging-version} (no $) and [source,xml,subs=attributes+]
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -79,15 +79,18 @@ Running the previous example should give the following output:
 
 [NOTE]
 ====
-SmallRye Reactive Messaging uses SLF4J as logger.
-Check the https://www.slf4j.org/manual.html[SLF4J documentation] to configure the logs.
+SmallRye Reactive Messaging uses JBoss-logger as logger.
+
 For testing purpose, you can simply add the following dependency to your `pom.xml` file:
 [source,xml]
 ----
 <dependency>
-  <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
-  <artifactId>slf4j-simple</artifactId>
-  <version>1.7.30</version>
+    <groupId>org.jboss.slf4j</groupId>
+    <artifactId>slf4j-jboss-logging</artifactId>
+    <version>${slf4j-jboss-logging.version}</version>

nodes.bodyText: I'm confused now... Do you mean that I need to configure slf4j, but I don't have any "backend" defined?

 [NOTE]
 ====
-SmallRye Reactive Messaging uses SLF4J as logger.
-Check the https://www.slf4j.org/manual.html[SLF4J documentation] to configure the logs.
+SmallRye Reactive Messaging uses JBoss-logger as logger.
+
 For testing purpose, you can simply add the following dependency to your `pom.xml` file:
 [source,xml]
 ----
 <dependency>
-  <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
-  <artifactId>slf4j-simple</artifactId>
-  <version>1.7.30</version>
+    <groupId>org.jboss.slf4j</groupId>
+    <artifactId>slf4j-jboss-logging</artifactId>
+    <version>${slf4j-jboss-logging.version}</version>
+    <scope>test</scope>
 </dependency>
 ----
-====
+
+Check the https://www.slf4j.org/manual.html[SLF4J documentation] to configure the logs.

nodes.bodyText: It might be a good idea to add length. Though it's the same as the default right now, if the default changed we would get different numbers output
That would apply to all @MessageBundle usage
Same on the length for @MessageLogger
This, and other loggers, should extend BasicLogger as per wiki
It's odd to me that exceptions and messaging are separated, as they're the same kind of thing
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,107 @@
+# This document is intended to establish the ranges for message IDs in the various sub-projects.
+
+# Range     = owner
+
+# Provider (smallrye-reactive-messaging-provider)
+00000-00099 = exceptions
